title: Convert all product prices from USD to Indian Rupees (INR) across the website

requirements.text: Update the frontend currency formatting utility so all displayed prices are shown in Indian Rupees (INR) with the ₹ symbol and Indian number formatting (e.g., en-IN). Apply USD→INR conversion consistently for any existing price values that are currently treated as USD minor-units (cents).

quotes: the product rate which you have mentioned in the website convert them to indian rupess

acceptanceCriteria: All UI locations that currently show "$" currency formatting (via the shared currency utility) display prices as INR (₹) instead.
The conversion from USD to INR is applied consistently anywhere a product price is shown (same input value results in same INR output across pages).
Currency formatting uses Indian locale formatting (e.g., 1,00,000 style grouping) rather than en-US grouping.

requirements.text: Replace all user-facing USD price labels and placeholders in price entry fields with INR equivalents (e.g., change "Base Price ($)" and "Your Desired Price ($)" to INR wording and ₹ examples) so the UI no longer references dollars.
acceptanceCriteria: Shopkeeper product creation form no longer shows "$" in the price label and examples.
Bargain offer dialog no longer shows "$" in the desired price label and examples.
No visible "$" remains in the product discovery, product detail, cart, or product-management flows.

requirements.text: Ensure cart subtotal/total display matches the same USD→INR conversion logic used for individual product prices so totals and line items are consistent.
acceptanceCriteria: Cart subtotal/total show INR (₹) and are consistent with the converted line-item prices.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui (read-only paths).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only introduce migration code if strictly necessary.
nonGoals: Adding real-time exchange-rate fetching from external APIs.
Redesigning the application UI beyond the currency text/format updates.
